title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.7
body:
Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and I'll be hosting this week's (and future) Patch Chats! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.7 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-77-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Feel free to ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can! 

Patch 7.7 has a number of buffs/nerfs to different champions such as Amumu, Bard, Graves, and Kassadin along with a number of other changes. I would definitely recommend checking them out! 

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt
Don “Aesah” Ding
Nicolas “Gleeb” Haddad
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Nicholas “Nickwu” Smith
Blake “S0be” Soberanis
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "TheLastAirbender" Halldorsson

I would like to know why did you give this buff to Lux? Nothing against her, but it seems quite a gigantic and questionable buff. Hope you could clarify my question.

After seeing it in playtests I would imagine it's a lot less significant of a buff in game than it looks on paper. On paper it's like "WOW THATS A LOT OF CDR FOR A POWERFUL SPELL," but in game it really only gets that CDR a couple of times per game and the cooldown is not quite enough to be able to multicast it in a teamfight- so it becomes more of a "ok we got a pick or got a kill in this fight lemme blast the mid wave real quick" type of tool.

While I agree that its a pretty big buff for her, she HAS TO get the final kill with 'R' to get the cool down. Most combos if they don't kill with Q-E-E-R end up killing with the reactivation of 'E' after 'R' has finished.

Do the questions have to be about things changed for this patch specifically?

If not, what do you think is wrong with the coin line of support items? It feels like there's a disconnect between where it starts with Ancient Coin (play super passive in lane) and Talisman of Ascension (Playmaking & hard engage). The armor and active just seem out of place. Wouldnt something else like +heal/shield power and a new active or some other mix of stats make more sense. Something just seems off no matter how strong the stats are on that line.

Nah we can talk about other stuff too. Coin is a great one and I'd love to talk about it. As a support player **coin always feels like the wrong choice** (unless you're Soraka) because it's the only truly selfish support item (again, unless you're Soraka and can donate away the HP it gives you).  Coin does not help your marksman- coin gives you health that you probably won't need as a regular support (you already have 3 biscuits). To compare, Spellthief is able to match the gold generation of Coin without optimizing the procs, and it also gives you pressure by buffing your ability to trade or all-in, and lane pressure is invaluable as a support. Relic shield heals your marksman and helps push the wave, both of which in some way give power to your buddy. Coin does neither- it doesn't assist your marksman in trades and it doesn't give you lane pressure or help push. It gives you lots of health that you likely don't need as a regular support.

To add to your point, post lane phase it feels torn between a selfish item still (Raptor MS passive) and a teamplay item (Shurelia's Reverie MS buff). It's quite expensive as it gives a lot of selfish stats to the support, but at the same time has an expensive active teamplay tool. It's super weird and at its current price point it's hard to give a good enough reason for why I should buy Talisman over pretty much any other support item.

Hope that helps describe a little bit of the item's weirdness
Coin does give early cdr, so I would argue theres a case for it helping your marksman on most enchanters, not just raka. Going all the way to talisman does feel kinda meh though.

I don't play ADC or support, but I they're both capable of doing some awesome stuff, and experiencing those things as their teammate and enemy was super exciting. Personally, I don't think the perks they gain when played together are super huge (except maybe that recall). In my opinion, Rakan has better synergy with Kalista/Lucian than he does with Xayah. There are some really neat combos you can set up with them. Like if Lucian is in front of Rakan, Rakan can dash to him, Lucian can dash forward, Rakan can dash to him again, and then dash in for an engage. :o
HELPPPPPPPPPPP
Any notable build or rune set up you guys run that seem good

Standard marksmen stuff is good on Xayah- anything you'd run on Ashe, Varus, Caitlyn etc work great for her.

For Rakan he's also pretty good with standard Support pages- but because everyone seems to have their own flavor of support page I'll make my list here:
Reds: Armor (9x)
Yellows: Flat Health (6x)
Mana regenration per/5 (3x)
Blues: Magic Resist
Quints: 
Choose between 3x AP, 3x Armor, 3x HP, or any combination of the three. Generally HP/Armor/AP are most efficient in the quint slots, although HP is just slightly more efficient. Personally I like stacking armor quints but Rakan is also good with a baseline of 15 AP.

I didn't play them in testing, but I loved playing against and with Rakan. His playmaking ability is huge and super flashy AND it was awesome to see in action.
Rakan by far is the coolest champion I've worked on it a looooong time. I love him.  I can't wait till he comes out on live and I finally get to play him more.

Rammus main here (yeah I know it's kind of hard to wrap your mind around why someone would do that).  I think everyone would acknowledge that Rammus has a pretty bad/slow jungle clear just in general.  The one camp though where he could kind of "catch up" was the Raptor camp.  This "nerf" to the Raptors I think is going to really hurt Rammus.  Standard technique at level 2 was to Q (powerball) and then activate his W (Defensive Ball Curl).  If you did it right, the little raptors would all die just as his W wore off, or maybe one or two auto attacks later.  Basically his W allowed him to clear the little raptors because of the reflected damage back.  But lowering the Raptors damage means less reflected damage going back to them.  And then you increase their HP to boot, which means his super slow auto attacks (once his W wears off) will be all he has left to go after all the little Raptors and the big one as well.  Honestly, I'm not sure he'll even be able to clear the Raptor camp any more at low levels.  Did anyone test Rammus specifically with this change?  Wouldn't be a big deal normally, as I know different champs have different camps they can clear well, except that this was his one camp he could actually take early game.  Any insights thoughts appreciated.  Many thanks.

When it comes to marksman, I think Last Whisper shows more significant armor shred then Black Cleaver.

not in the mid game.

Last Whisper has 10 AD. This means spending a _significant _ 950 gold to upgrade your longsword into a Last Whisper doesn't give any AD at all, which means unless you know you are going to be attacking a target that has a lot of bonus armor (not armor), its very risky to spend that much gold on stats that could be useless. a 1300 gold longsword.

Meanwhile, Black Cleaver shreds almost as much armor, and shreds ALL armor and not just bonus armor, so it is way more useful than LW when fighting squishies, has useful stats such as CDR, health and way more AD for your ability scalings; and also has a much smoother build path than the Last Whisper items (also Giant Slayer suffers from the same dilemma as LW, its useful against health stackers but not against people who have the same health as you). This is why Lucian loves Black Cleaver 2nd item- the armor pen is much less situational than LW.

Late game as a hypercarry ADC you become much more dependent on auto attacks and don't care about your spells as much (see Caitlyn) so the 20% CDR from BC is a waste of gold. Late game when everyone has all the armor they've decided to get, LW is great with a massive 45% bonus pen since it's more trustworthy. But it's been intentionally balanced so that it is drastically less effective on targets with low amounts of bonus armor. This is why a Lucian can get a BC pre 15 minutes, but if he got a LW it is practically useless against the other adc and support.

hope this helps and if im wrong about something feel free to imput, Rito staff.

'Sup dudes. I can see a lot of people already asked about the Lux buffs.

* What's the status of Jinx's W critting?

* How's LB doing?

* Is Shaco being pushed towards building bruiser instead of assassin?

* Are any of the assassin updates likely to be reverted?

* Who did you vote for in [/r/LoL Survivor?](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/63m7p5/rlol_survivor_round_8/)

* Meddler mentioned Riot would like to do some work on Heimerdinger, no promises. What do you think needs to be fixed?

* Can Mid Malzahar withstand any more nerfs to Support Malzahar?

Yo!

* Jinx W critting was pulled in favor of a lower cooldown on her Chompers (E) as she ranks it up. 

* LB is overall pretty weak (~45% winrate),  still sees occasional pro player (NA Promotions, EULCS, LCK), and has an above 50% winrate for experienced Leblanc Players (>100 games played on the character)

* Changes to Shaco will be aimed at making bruiser builds, such as Titanic Hydra + Triforce, less effective and solidifying his niche as an assassin. 

* Have not heard any serious discussion around them being reverted so far.

* Didn't see this until now, but Yasuo  200% of the time

* I'm not an experienced Heimerdinger player, but my uninformed opinion is that he needs better tools for defending against ganks, trading without pushing the minion wave, and potentially more utility in team fights. 

* Probably? He's still rocking a 51.5% winrate, and obviously it will depend on what type of nerf gets applied to him, but even now, after the malz support nerfs, he still performs well in the midlane.

I feel that the change to Volibear doesn't really do much for him. I like that it bounces more but I feel like the delay in the lightning bounce hurts him although it is thematically appropriate. Do you feel like the ult changes actually help him enough or does he need much more work?

Probably a bit of both.  I only got one playtest on him, but the extra bounces netted me like 3 kills. It felt ridiculously powerful.  Know that was likely the best case scenario, but I felt like my payoff for autoattacking anywhere in a fight was high.  Hope you try it out and enjoy.

Hi guys, were the experimental Quinn changes of moving Skystrike to R(W) pulled? I thought those were pretty cool; any plans to try out something different if that's the case?
We've shelved the Quinn explorations for now because we found the play patterns weren't working out as well as they could be.

Was the adjust on Amumu simply to make players feel like they're dealing damage when playing him? Otherwise, is this more or less damage in your opinion?


P.S. Does Gunblade's passive give you health from the damage dealt via your passive but by other players or would it heal the mage who triggered the passive?

The adjustments were for quality of life (W, R) and clarity/visibility (P). Amumu's passive MR reduction was powerful but hard to feel, especially as the Amumu player. Being able to see the true damage pop up should help add clairty to what your passive is doing

As for the gunblade thing I have no idea- I imagine it would work the same way Ivern's E + gunblade interaction would

I believe the damage "given" to allies, wether via Amumu passive or any other effect (Janna's shield, Nami's on-hit, Censer passive, Leona passive, Braum' passive, Sona's blue aura, etc.) doesn't trigger Gunblade at all, the same way it isn't counted for your stats at all in the end of game screen.

(As a side note, that leads to highly misleading stats in the end-of-game screen for a lot of supports, with their impact mostly non visible.)
